meanings.definition: To cut a groove or channel in a material, typically wood, to form a joint or to allow another piece to fit into it.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was rabbeting the wood to make a perfect joint.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to do rabbeting in her woodworking class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was rabbeting the tree trunk to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: His words were rabbeting into her heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the saw rabbeting through the wood echoed in the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a rabbet.
meanings.sent1: The rabbeting of the wood was essential for the project.
meanings.sent2: He studied the technique of rabbeting for his woodworking assignment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the art of rabbeting, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the smooth rabbeting of a master craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The precision of his rabbeting was admired by all who saw his work.
